paper_abstract: In this paper, the problem of C-2 Hermite interpolation by triarcs composed of Pythagorean-hodograph (PH) quintics is considered. The main idea is to join three arcs of PH quintics at two unknown points - the,first curve interpolates given C-2 Hermite data at one side, the third one interpolates the same type of given data at the other side and the middle arc is joined together with C-2 continuity to the first and the third arc. For any set of C-2 planar boundary data (two points with associated first and second derivatives) we construct four possible interpolants. The best possible approximation order is 4. Analogously, for a set of C-2 spatial boundary data we find a six-dimensional family of interpolating quintic PH triarcs. The results are confirmed by several examples. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: C-2 Hermite interpolation by Pythagorean-hodograph quintic triarcs
